actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-291, by Mr. Wheat.

Rule provides for consideration of S. 1745 with 1 hour and 30 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. The resolution provides for one motion to commit the Senate bill which may not contain instructions. Bill is closed to amendments.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 70.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 327 - 93 (Roll no. 385).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (S. 1745) to amend the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to strengthen and improve Federal civil rights laws, to provide for damages in cases of intentional employment discrimination, to clarify provisions regarding disparate impact actions, and for other purposes.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of S. 1745 (civil rights).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (S. 1745) to amend the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to strengthen and improve Federal civil rights laws, to provide for damages in cases of intentional employment discrimination, to clarify provisions regarding disparate impact actions, and for other purposes.
